sn44.6:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn44.6:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of solitude, went to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita,
sn44.6:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn44.6:4.6: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, does a Realized One exist after death?” …
sn44.6:4.7: “Reverend, when asked these questions, you say that this has not been declared by the Buddha.
sn44.6:4.10: What’s the cause, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.6:5.1: “Reverend, if you like, love, and enjoy form, and don’t truly see the cessation of form, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or
sn44.6:5.2: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.6:5.3: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.6:5.4: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:5.5: If you like, love, and enjoy feeling …
sn44.6:5.8: consciousness, and don’t truly see the cessation of consciousness, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:5.9: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:6.1: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy form …
sn44.6:6.6: consciousness, and you truly see the cessation of consciousness, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:6.7: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:6.8: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.6:7.1: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.6:7.3: If you like, love, and enjoy existence, and don’t truly see the cessation of existence, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:7.4: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:7.5: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy existence, and you truly see the cessation of existence, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:7.6: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:7.7: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.6:8.1: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.6:8.3: If you like, love, and enjoy grasping, and don’t truly see the cessation of grasping, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:8.4: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:8.5: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy grasping, and you truly see the cessation of grasping, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:8.6: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:8.7: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.6:9.1: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.6:9.3: If you like, love, and enjoy craving, and don’t truly see the cessation of craving, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:9.4: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:9.5: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy craving, and you truly see the cessation of craving, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …
sn44.6:9.6: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.6:9.7: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.6:10.1: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.6:10.2: “Seriously, reverend, what more could you want?
sn44.6:10.3: For one who is freed due to the ending of craving, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”
